Steps.Message: Audio augmentations can be used to play sounds and recordings back to the user. Let's try and create one. First, let's record an audio clip.
Press this button to start recording.
Press it again when you're finished recording.
Now that we've recorded an audio clip, you can play it back up here.
You can select this option if you want the audio to loop. You can turn it on now, or click Next.
Audio can just be played directly at full strength or it can be made to come from a single point. Moving away from that point will cause the audio to fade. Let's turn on that option.
The dial here sets how far from the source of the sound the audio will start to fade. We can leave it as is, just click Next.
We can also set that when the audio finishes playing, we jump to a specific step. Let's leave that option of for now and click Next.
Let's load the audio into the scene. To do that, just click the Done button below.
Let's lower the UI so we can take a look at and listen to the augmentation we just created.
This orb represents the point of origin (source) of your created audio. You can now hold the middle of it to reposition it. That's it for the tutorial!
